content.description: Start 15' left of Desperado at a cleaned slab. Climb the slab up to a big tree ledge at about 35'. Follow the series of headwalls straight up to a two bolt anchor on a blueberry ledge.

climbs.name: Perdido
climbs.fa: George Hurley, Jim Nupp, David Giampietro

content.description:
This fun route starts 50' left of Sandinista and 25' right from Ol' Dirt Dog. Starts on a clean white streak in front of a standing dead tree, friction up to 2 horizontal cracks. Move right to the end of the cracks and up to a right leaning crack, at the end of where the crack stops going right proceed straight up to the large ledge.   (tricky gear placement to protect the move up to the large ledge, can be done with a red tri-cam and a stacked nut in a solution pocket)  

  Straight back on the large tree ledge proceed up the clean rock to a 2 bolt anchor. 

  Standard trad rack including tri-cams  up to a #2(gold) Camalot 

  FA: George Hurley, Jim Nupp & David Giampietro August 2016
content.protection: Standard single rack up to #2 (Gold Camalot) include tricams pink,red and brown.
content.location:
Mt Molly, Central Wall New Durham, NH 

  Alternate Approach: This is a very easy and enjoyable approach different from the book and that listed on Mountain Project. Travel 2.4 miles from the intersection of Powder Mill and North Shore Rd (Merrymeeting Rd) to a very small pull out on the left where you can park. Follow the trail (well groomed perhaps old logging road) through the boulders until at a well marked trail on the right with cairns, take this trail. Walk approx. 25 minutes total (Almost to the top of Mt Molly) turn right and up off the trail with a short 100 yard bush whack to the base of the cliff (Central Wall Area).

content.description: About 100 left of Sandinista is another cleaned streak just before the Corner Crack. Climb up the unprotected slab to the headwall. Climb the headwall placing gear along the way. Belay and rap from the large tree at the top.

Walk left about 50 yards away from the Satellite Wall down a short steep wall. This route is the first cleaned streak at the end of the short wall. Climb up a well featured slab placing gear and slinging trees along the way. Pull over the short headwall to a spacious ledge. Continue up the dirty slab to the trees above.

Start 15' left of El Mariachi. Climb a cleaned slab up to the crux mantle at a shelf with a small tree. Continue up an easier slab to a ledge. Climb the steep headwall with a big pocket up to another ledge and continue up the face with big horizontal holds to a two bolt anchor

Just around the corner to the left of Ol Dirt Dogg is the obvious corner crack system. Climb up the corner/crack placing gear. When the corner ends move up the slab to the trees above. Rap from trees or walk off.

pathTokens: New Durham Area  (Longstack, Devil's Den, Rines Hill, etc.)

content.description: This section of cliff is a bit broken up but offers some great moderate slab climbs that provide great views from the top. The routes here are about 70-80 feet in length.
